media: blog posts, white papers, web pages
experience.description: Collaborated with engineering and product teams to create a range of strategic content that helped drive a $10M+ sales pipeline. Wrote sales enablement content across DroneDeploy’s product suite: dock automation, ground  robotics, Data on Demand, and cybersecurity solutions. Developed “Your AI In the Sky” tagline for DroneDeploy’s Safety AI rollout. Wrote white papers on all aspects of reality capture – ground control points to underground utilities to facade inspections.
impact: Engagement rate to take meaningful action 1.7%
Share of MRR --$2.5m for ground robotics

experience.description: Sentry is used by millions of developers to monitor their applications. There I wrote content and copy that defined the developer experience: blogs, video scripts, social, website, drip campaigns, and long-form. Product releases run the risk of getting bogged down in their own jargon. For Sentry’s Performance product release, this meant turning jargony benefits (such as improved Apdex scores and p95 response times) into a simple, differentiating insight.My tagline – See Slow Faster – articulated Sentry's competitive advantage, propelling the unicorn to 3x ARR and cement its status as a leader in application performance monitoring.
impact: Engagement rate to take meaningful action 1.7%

experience.description: Momentum is an experiential advertising agency.  While there I wrote a pitch deck that won Facebook’s FBIQ account, led Espolon tequila's social media, shaped messaging for Verizon’s go90 streaming platform launch, and created on-premise product activations for Jameson and Glenfiddich

projects.description: Ceros is an experiential content creation platform; think photoshop for front-end code.  My role was to discover and execute use cases for customers in trial, write content from a mobile-first mindset, and lead the strategic briefing process. As content strategist, I was tasked to lead the creative conversation during a client’s trial period. I did this by relating to clients that static content written from a paper perspective – even if insightful and strategic– is viewed by their customers as merely lumps of words. From writing strategic briefs to filming webinars to pitching experiential activations, I was central to turning static .pdfs into interactive, mobile-friendly content that showcased Ceros's value to its clients

Tagline, brand manifesto, and social media rollout for a tequila owned by five NBA owners.Cutting through the clutter of celebrity tequila brands. George Clooney. The Rock. Kylie Jenner. Bryan Cranston. Celebrity tequila is a crowded space. So when Michael Jordan and four other NBA owners started their own tequila company, I was there to help them find a way to help their brand stand out among the stars. Cincoro translates to 'five rings'. And so the story of Cincoro Tequila is the passion and competitive spirit its five owners share as they each chase their next championship ring.
lines: Some owners autograph their bottles. Ours create a signature taste.

projects.title: DroneDeploy Safety AI launch
projects.description: As part of DroneDeploy's Safety AI gtm campaign, this article explores how AI is purpose-built to protect workers, fortify compliance, and support a culture of safety.

For Sentry’s Performance product release, this meant turning jargony benefits (such as improved Apdex scores and p95 response times) into a simple, differentiating insight. My tagline – See Slow Faster – articulated Sentry's competitive advantage, propelling the unicorn to 3x ARR and cement its status as a leader in application performance monitoring.

projects.title: DroneDeploy AI content
projects.description: Delivered 25+ Python automation projects for global clients, including web scraping, API bots, and data pipelines. Built GenAI-powered chatbots and autonomous agents using LangChain, LangGraph, and OpenAI APIs, reducing manual work by 60%.

projects.title: Sentry Dogfooding Chronicles
projects.description: Dogfooding is the process in which a company uses its own product as a quality control mechanism. Think: the hair club for men guy. With Dogfooding Chronicles, we could tell the stories of software engineers  used the platform to improve the platform, syndicating unique anecdotes of how dev teams approached the inevitable flaws in their work with honesty and humor.

links.name: Using Sentry Performance to get Sentry Performant

projects.title: FBIQ
projects.description: Winning the hearts, minds, and budgets of media strategists everywhereFacebook IQ was a tool that helped brands better target audiences through context-based programmatic ads. For example: if a facebook friend announced their engagement, FBIQ would shoehorn contextual ads in your feed -- things like bachelor party destinations and 20 percent off cummerbund rentals.To debut FBIQ, Facebook invited over two hundred media leaders to premiere events in New York, Chicago and Los Angeles. They tasked Momentum Worldwide with thinking through event activations that could tie Facebook's culture with the benefits the tool offered advertisers.As part of Momentum's pitch team, I helped think through creative opportunities for FBIQ's premiere event ranging from invites to booking talent, on-premise activations, and follow-up communications.

projects.title: Espolon
projects.description: ML-powered laptop price prediction system built with Streamlit. Features clean interface, fast predictions, and easy deployment via Docker. Uses key attributes like brand, CPU, RAM, storage, GPU, and screen size for accurate real-time price estimates.

projects.title: GE
projects.description: Designing technical content for GE's aviation division included layering benefits across hover states, data visualizations, and interactive quizzes.

projects.title: Ceros internal
projects.description:
Ceros is a B2B content creation platform; think photoshop for front-end code. Many Ceros clients in trial were suffering from blank platform syndrome; that is, while they had an appreciation of the tool itself, they lacked an understanding of its application to their broader content initiatives.
As content strategist, I was tasked to lead the creative conversation during a client’s trial. I approached this by relating to clients that most digital content is still being written as if from a typewriter — despite being read on a screen. And that static content written from this paper perspective – even if well-written and strategic – is viewed by their customers as merely lumps of words.
From writing strategic briefs to pitching experiential activations and rewriting client inputs, I was central to turning static .pdfs into interactive, mobile-friendly content in ways which showcased the Ceros platform.

projects.title: gpay
projects.description:
Content to get developers to check out a checkout API. Gpay is a one-touch checkout experience that works seamlessly between applications and e-commerce sites.
Like all things Google, Gpay was designed to be efficient ( it’s instrumented with only a few lines of code). Which means video content for its I/O premiere needed to act likewise.
So instead of a smug, stemwinding video that wastes a developer’s time with phony rapport, we got out of our own way and just told the simplest, most direct path to instrumentation.

projects.title: HP Presence launch
projects.description: Making hybrid work, work for employees and employers.The context.The pandemic altered the fabric of society. Nowhere was this more evident than the corporate office. As a content strategist on Transmission's HP account, I helped  position their Presence videoconferencing product suite to be the connective tissue for distributed workforces. How businesses can build out their hybrid work infrastructure to seamlessly incorporate devices, solutions, and services across distributed teams.The world of work continues to evolve. And the tools employees use for that work need to evolve with it. And that starts with HP Presence building out intelligent meeting experiences that fully incorporate remote workers such that their points can be heard with the same volume and clarity as those physically in the room.How IT professionals can calibrate their offices to the new normal

links.name: A New Blueprint for an Uncertain World.
The New Office For the Way People Want to Work

projects.title: Airbnb
projects.description: Coming out of the pandemic (and the subsequent great resignation), competition for talent has ratcheted up. To that end, companies are changing how they view career websites: from a mere job repository to a digital moment where they can define their culture to candidates.  While working at talent agency Symphony Studio, I was assigned to writing Airbnb’s career website. That first meant establishing their Employer Brand Proposition: that is, the values and benefits which differentiates Airbnb from not only their competitors, but the workforce at large. Working with Airbnb executives and HR stakeholders, we articulated AirBnb’s core values, their Live and Work Anywhere policy, and growth opportunities with responsive, mobile-friendly content that speaks simply, directly, and strategically to candidates.

projects.title: Sentry Customer Stories
projects.description: The consequences of poor application performance are both real and terrifying: lost customers, lost trust from your team, and lost confidence in your abilities. It’s why every developer remembers those moments where their solution improves both process and performance -- and why Sentry celebrates their Great Moments in Application Monitoring:

projects.title: Sentry discover
projects.description: To get the right answer, you have to ask the right question. Enter Discover, Sentry’s new query builder. It helps you analyze raw event data across your application. For example, if you want to understand which parts of your code are responsible for triggering the most errors, use Discover to analyze everything from errors by release to slowest transactions by end user..

links.name: Asking the right query with discover

projects.title: Sentry instrumentation
projects.description: A dev tool is only as good as its ability to speak the language of its developers.

links.name: Why debugging Javascript sucks (and what you can do about it)

presetAnswers.versusAI: I am what ai ain’t.Your customers deserve better than to read robot. They want a human voice behind your brand — one which piques curiosity, not parrot information; one which intrigues, not inundates; and one that doesn’t regurgitate words already written, but reveals fresh insights unique to your brand.
